page.title: 10THE BIG RACE
page.content: On June 22nd 1985 over 1000 spectators gathered to see the gruelling hill climb from South Moor to Quaking Houses,which was part of the 70 miles Vaux Brewery Grand Prix Cycling Race. The race was established in 1961 over 116 miles and attracted world wide entries;contining until 1970 when Vaux withdrew sponsorship. Now Vaux have brought back the race over a shorter distance,attracting entries from as far as Scotland and Yorkshire.Starting and finishing at South Moor,the race passes through Quaking Houses,the prime climb for 10 laps. There are 3 categories in the race with prizes totalling Â£1000.The Grand Prix is now recognized as one of the premier races in the U.K.due to the excellence of the course and competent local organization.
